intro: Clidemia brachystephana var. longidentata, commonly known as the long-toothed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a serrated margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. This plant is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
